programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: The first line of treatment for the millions of kids who are diagnosed with Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD) or Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) is often drugs. Is medication the best treatment?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Backstabbing takes many forms - lying, spreading gossip and fueling nasty rumors. Dr. Phil's guests say the ultimate betrayal didn't come from a stranger, but from their own sister!

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Renee and Lee insist their 6-year-old granddaughter is not safe in the care of her parents, Chris and Jessica, because they are severe alcoholics. Despite admitting their alcoholism, Chris and Jessica insist they are great parents, and claim Chris’ parents stole their daughter from them when they demanded Chris and Jessica sign over temporary guardianship of their little girl. Dr. Phil shows Renee and Lee shocking footage of what his cameras captured during Chris and Jessica’s home interviews. After seeing the footage, will Chris and Jessica still stand by their position that their drinking does not place their daughter in danger?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Pedophiles once lurked in parks and around schoolyards, and then they prowled the playground of the World Wide Web. Now these predators have a more sinister method at their fingertips sending explicit text messages directly to your child's cell phone. Dr. Phil examines the latest technological threats to your kids and shows you how to protect them.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: A headline making story of a husband’s affair with a co-worker that led to murder. Now the wife and the mistress come face to face for the first time.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Dr. Phil advises parents struggling to raise teens in an image-focused culture.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Three friends confront former friend, Sarah, who faked terminal cancer, miscarriages, and used a wheelchair to pretend she had muscular dystrophy.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: In part two, will accused liar Sarah, who fibbed about having cancer, miscarriage and muscular dystrophy, change her ways?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: From bad table manners to public spitting, Dr. Phil is determined to bring an end to the rudeness epidemic.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Parents suspect foul play in their daughter's alleged death by suicide.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: A bride-to-be takes on her mother-in-law in an ugly feud.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: The case of Thomas Cogdell, who confessed to his sister's muder at age 12, is examined.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: A mother says her teen daughter is aggressive, violent and a bully who crossed a line when she threatened to shoot her teacher and other students.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: Destoni’s Drama: Will She Accept Help? (Pt 2)
programme.desc: Dr. Phil wants a violent teen to meet someone who could change her life. How will she react?

programme.title: Dr.Phil
programme.sub-title: Mom Needs to Cut the Cord
programme.desc: Samantha and her sister Sarah say their mother, Stacy, is very successful as a special education teacher and behaviorist, but hey claim their mother has allowed their 33 year old brother Ben to live rent free for the past 2 years, while he lays by the pool. Stacy’s husband, Doug, says he moved out and refuses to come home until Stacy kicks his stepson out of the house. Ben insists he is not taking advantage of his mother’s hospitality and kindness; he is just stuck in a rut.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Sixty-four-year-old Josie says she met the love of her life, Victor, on Facebook. Even though he’s Nigerian, 30 years younger, and she’s never physically met him, she insists it’s true love. She’s purchased a ticket to Nigeria and hopes to marry Victor, but her older sister, Carmen, her best friend, Angela, and her 19-year-old son, Anthony, say Josie is acting like a teenage fool. They believe Victor is conning Josie into marrying him for a green card. Dr. Phil took cameras to Nigeria to find Victor to see if he’s telling Josie the truth. Josie’s family says they want Dr. Phil to convince Josie that this relationship will never work. Is Victor who he says he is, and will Josie leave for Nigeria after hearing what Dr. Phil has to say?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Today's guests are sick and tired of a relative's never-ending mooching ways! Will these extreme freeloaders learn to stand on their own two feet?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Do you have a relative scheming to get money from a rich aunt, uncle or even parents when they pass away?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Dr. Phil's guests haven't even been married a year and are already wondering if it’s time to call it quits.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Dr. Phil works with three young couples in relationships.

programme.title: Dr.Phil
programme.sub-title: The Wrath of My Mother Wanda (PT 1)
programme.desc: Things get a little wild with a very passionate guest named Wanda. Her daughter, Tiffany, told her mother she ruined her wedding, among many other things. But Wanda says Tiffany is making up lies about her and she knows why; Wanda claims it’s payback for Wanda having an affair and abandoning the family when Tiffany was just 14 years old. Wanda says her bipolar disorder is at fault for her earlier actions. Tiffany says she is sick of her mother blaming her mental health issues for her bad behavior. Tiffany says if Dr. Phil can’t fix this, then her mother is out of her life for good. Can Dr. Phil get this mother-daughter duo to see eye to eye for the first time?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Things get even more heated when Wanda is accused of stealing her daughter in-law's wedding rings. Does Wanda have the rings? And can Dr. Phil get this family communicating for the first time in the right way?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Meet the "Boomerang Generation" - children who go to college and then move back in with their parents after leaving the nest, sometimes multiple times. Dr. Phil shares advice for parents and their adult children who want to end this cycle.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Parents are concerned about the extreme measures their daughters take to get and keep a boyfriend.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: Is My Sister a Drama Queen or Really Sick?
programme.desc: A woman believes her sister lied about being diagnosed with more than 70 health conditions.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: The conversation continues with a woman who says her sister lied about health diagnoses for attention.

programme.title: Dr.Phil
programme.sub-title: Dad Accused of Faking His Own Death
programme.desc: A man's claim of his father's disappearance leads to a shoking decption.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: Why Is My Mom Faking Cancer?
programme.desc: Jessica says her mother, Patricia, claims she is defying the odds by becoming a record-setting weight lifter while simultaneously battling Stage 3 brain cancer. But Jessica insists her mother isn’t sick at all and that she is lying about her health to gain sympathy and attention. She says Patricia has been spinning stories about various medical ailments for as long as she can remember -- and it’s time to come clean. Patricia strongly denies her daughter’s accusations and insists her diagnosis and incredible survival story are real. Why does she claim Jessica is out to get her? Emotions run high when mother and daughter meet on Dr. Phil’s stage. Do Patricia’s claims hold up? And, can this mother and daughter repair their fractured relationship?

programme.title: Dr.Phil
programme.desc: Dr. Phil takes goes inside the unthinkable: making your own child sick to fulfill a disturbing need for attention. The idea might sound unimaginable, but for people with a psychological disorder called Munchausen by Proxy, it's irresistible. Note: Viewer discretion is advised.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: A woman accuses a former friend of fake pregnancies.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Did a woman accused of fake pregnancies really lie?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: Our Dad Left Us for a “Kennedy Heir”!
programme.desc: Trisha and Danielle say they are furious with their father, Ron, who they say abandoned their dying mother -- his wife of 30 years -- to plan a wedding with an alleged Kennedy heiress he met online. The daughters are convinced “Misty Kennedy” is really a catfish, and they want to open their father’s eyes. But Ron says despite never having met “Misty” in person, he believes his fiancée is the real deal and the love of his life. Dr. Phil brings everyone together in search of answers. Who is “Misty Kennedy”?
